org.jtrim.image.transform

Class TransformedImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.TransformedImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject

    public final class TransformedImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject
    Defines the output of an image transformer.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should be treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageTransformerData are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    ImageTransformer

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransformedImage

        public TransformedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                ImagePointTransformer pointTransformer)
        Creates a new TransformedImage from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        image - the result of the image transformation. This argument can be null is the result is a null image (possibly because the input image was null).
        pointTransformer - the coordinate transformation which transforms the location of the pixels on the input image to the location of the pixels on the output image. This argument can be null, in which case an identity transformation is assumed.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the result of the image transformation. That is, this method returns the image specified at construction time.
        Returns:
        the result of the image transformation. This method may return null if null was specified at construction time.

      • getPointTransformer

        public ImagePointTransformer getPointTransformer()
        Returns the coordinate transformation which transforms the location of the pixels on the input image to the location of the pixels on the output image.
        Returns:
        the coordinate transformation which transforms the location of the pixels on the input image to the location of the pixels on the output image. This method never returns null, if null was specified at construction time the result is an identity coordinate transformation.

      • transformSrcToDest

        public void transformSrcToDest(java.awt.geom.Point2D src,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D dest)
        A convenience method to call getPointTransformer().transformSrcToDest(src, dest).
        Parameters:
        src - the point to be transformed to the coordinate system of the result image. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        dest - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null but can be the same object as src.

      • transformDestToSrc

        public void transformDestToSrc(java.awt.geom.Point2D dest,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D src)
                        throws java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        A convenience method to call getPointTransformer().transformDestToSrc(dest, src).
        Parameters:
        dest - the point to be transformed to the coordinate system of the input image. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        src - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null but can be the same object as dest.
        Throws:
        java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException - thrown if the transformation from the coordinate system of the input image cannot be inverted

      • getApproxMemorySize

        public long getApproxMemorySize()
        Returns the approximate memory retention of the resulting image. This method returns the same value as ImageData.getApproxSize(getImage()) would.
        Specified by:
        getApproxMemorySize in interface org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject
        Returns:
        he approximate memory retention of the resulting image. This method always returns a value greater than or equal to zero.
        See Also:
        ImageData.getApproxSize(BufferedImage)
